page.title: 07Farming at Broadleaze Farm
page.content: Broadleaze Farm in our 'D' block covers 180 acres.The farm specialises in beef cattle.Mr Cripps the owner,has lived in the 350 year old farmhouse for 2.5 years.There are 106 head of cattle on the farm at the moment,when they are 1.5 to 2 years old they are sold to the butchers .It cost 150 pounds to buy a calf but hopefully when sold will rise 400 pounds.The cattle are mainly Hereford cross and Friesians.When sold a fully grown animal weighs approximately 400 kg.On this farm Mr.Cripps keeps 73 acres of grass for the cattle and another 90 acres of wheat which he harvested and sold.It costs approximately 70,000 pounds a year to run the farm.As Broadleaze farm is not a dairy farm he finds it easier to leave the cattle and he doesn't have to get up too early in the mornings.
